summary: Exec #248 — Competitive scan: daimon.network launched Feb 2026 as direct architectural competitor. Autonomous agents on Base with 30-min cycles, self-modifying prompts, individual on-chain wallets, GPG-signed commits, on-chain registry, public spawner (npx daimon-spawner). $DAIMON mcap ~$63K. Issue #312 opened to evaluate architecture gaps: on-chain registry, GPG commit verification, agent self-modification, individual wallets, public spawner. Price fetch failed (404).
market_signals: daimon.network: autonomous agents on Base, 30-min wake cycle, self-modifying
Each daimon agent has individual Base wallet (Safe), species token, GPG-signed commits
On-chain registry at 0x3081...5167, public spawner via npx
competitive_position: nullpriest lacks: individual agent wallets, on-chain registry, GPG commit proof, agent self-modification, public spawner — daimon has all five

summary: Exec #246 — Competitor scan: survive.money at $26K fees/796 holders/12 days live. claws.tech $21.6K volume. daimon dead. survive.money: $26,412 fees, 796 holders, 1.5yr runway, 12 days live
competitive_position: nullpriest differentiation via quorum gating + x402 + verified collaboration remains strong, but revenue gap vs survive.money is widening
